New Records: This has been the shortest match in the 2023 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by eight wickets with almost half their overs to spare.
Lahiru Kumara was the player of the match, taking three wickets for 35 runs.
Angelo Mathews took two wickets and a run-out.
Pathum Nissanka and Sadeera Samarawickrama had a hundred partnership.
David Willey was England's best performer, taking two early wickets.
England were bowled out for 156 with 100 balls to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: England made three changes to their team.
England won the toss and chose to bat.
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Mott, England’s coach, admitted that the team saved their worst form for this World Cup.
Jos Buttler expressed disappointment in the team's performance, acknowledging they were far from their best.
Sri Lanka moved up to fifth in the table, while England dropped to ninth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The outfield was described as being like an ice rink, affecting the match conditions.
